channel.description:
hello everyone! Well straight to businesses then. Is there an easier way of including JS files? The traditional method is
[code] <script type="text/javascript" src="./scripts/someJSfile.js"></script> [/code]
but i'm going to have alot of JS Includes, so is there a neater way to do this?
Cheers ~Marluxia

item.title: [req] Better way of including JS files?
item.dc:creator: @marluxia marluxia
item.description:
@marluxia wrote:

it’s like your method sppt but neater last result (when the client formats the code)

http://ajaxpatterns.org/archive/On-Demand_Javascript.php

function init() {
	var jsfiles = new Array(
		"something1.js", 
		"baroxic2.js", 
		"soandso3.js",
		"whatever4.js"
	);

	var head = document.getElementsByTagName("head")[0];
	for(var i = 0; i < jsfiles.length; i++) {
		script = document.createElement("script");
		script.setAttribute("type", "text/javascript");
		script.setAttribute("src", "./scripts/" + jsfiles[i]);
		head.appendChild(script);
	}
}

init();

you could always try this code:
[php]<?php
$dir = “./scripts/”;
if(is_dir($dir)) {
if($handle = opendir($dir)) {
while(($file = readdir($handle)) !== false) {
if(substr($file, -3) == “.js”) {
echo “<script type=“text/javascript” src=”".$dir.$file."">\n";
}

	}
}

}
?>[/php]
just put all .js files in $dir
